Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that a statue of Jefferson Davis is being replaced with one of Barack Obama, when in fact, it is a fake news story.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a fake news article from a website pretending to be affiliated with Fox News Channel.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the fake news article is true and presents it as a fact.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no plan to replace a Jefferson Davis statue with an Obama likeness.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by presenting misleading information and using bits and pieces from a real news story to create a fake narrative.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating bias in this claim.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no alternative explanation bias in this claim.
